issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://delta.mobile.app.android.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdelta.mobile.app.android.com)
### Comment
> Trips are completely unavailable on Android while the blocking is on. 
> 
> 
```
Username: @bauzer714
```

### Screenshots

  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/rwels2vxjy8w0go0wsg884wos04c480kfn0hj91qvk.png?nc=1)
</details>

issue.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.2.4 to 16.2.5

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.2.4 to 16.2.5.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.2.5

Patch Changes

  • #1687 9e02d9d Thanks @iiroj! - Fix unhandled promise rejection when spawning tasks (instead of the tasks themselves failing). Previously when a task failed to spawn, lint-staged also failed and the backup stash might not have been automatically restored.
Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.2.5

Patch Changes

  • #1687 9e02d9d Thanks @iiroj! - Fix unhandled promise rejection when spawning tasks (instead of the tasks themselves failing). Previously when a task failed to spawn, lint-staged also failed and the backup stash might not have been automatically restored.
Commits
  • 1f6a326 chore(changeset): release
  • 6ab937c ci: use separate caches for MSYS2 and Cygwin
  • 6d71384 fix: catch errors when calling spawn
  • 64e482b build(deps): update dev dependencies
  • 7e65124 fix: log spawn failure error
  • 9e02d9d fix: handle error when spawning of configured task fails
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=lint-staged&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=16.2.4&new-version=16.2.5)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body:
MV3 extension cannot update filters, so it will be fixed in the one of the next extension updates.
Until then you can add following rules to user rules:
```adblock
lukesitturn.com#%#//scriptlet('google-ima3')
lukesitturn.com#%#//scriptlet("abort-current-inline-script", "$", "/\.fadeIn|\.show\(.?\)/")
lukesitturn.com#%#//scriptlet("abort-current-inline-script", "encodeURIComponent", "break;case")
lukesitturn.com#%#//scriptlet('abort-current-inline-script', 'WebAssembly', 'atob')
```

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://nuldam.com/product/%EA%B3%A0%EB%8B%A8%EB%B0%B1-%EC%A0%80%EB%8B%B9-%EB%84%A4%EB%AA%A8-%EB%B0%94%EA%B2%8C%ED%8A%B8-90g-6%EB%B4%89-5%EA%B0%80%EC%A7%80-%EB%A7%9B%EC%B4%9D-12%EB%B4%89/564/category/47/display/1/#prdReview](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnuldam.com%2Fproduct%2F%25EA%25B3%25A0%25EB%258B%25A8%25EB%25B0%25B1-%25EC%25A0%2580%25EB%258B%25B9-%25EB%2584%25A4%25EB%25AA%25A8-%25EB%25B0%2594%25EA%25B2%258C%25ED%258A%25B8-90g-6%25EB%25B4%2589-5%25EA%25B0%2580%25EC%25A7%2580-%25EB%25A7%259B%25EC%25B4%259D-12%25EB%25B4%2589%2F564%2Fcategory%2F47%2Fdisplay%2F1%2F%23prdReview) ### Comment > Following the issue linked below, it appears that several URLs important to online merchants are being blocked as advertisements [issue](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214522) > > The URLs being blocked, such as > - https://static.alphwidget.com/script/Common-Script/PRODUCTION/alphacore_alpha_data.js? > - https://static.alphwidget.com/script/Upsell-Script/PRODUCTION/alpha-upsell-shadow-bundle.js? > - and other URLs matching the static.alphwidget.com^ pattern > > are not harmful resources. These scripts provide useful information to web users, such as displaying product reviews or recommending similar items. They display content that the page administrator (the online seller) intends to show. > > Because of this, it seems the content provided by these links is not harmful advertising. As a user, I am personally experiencing difficulties, especially when I try to view product reviews. > > I do not want to go through the inconvenience of having to disable Adblock, which is supposed to block harmful ads, just to shop online. > > I am reporting this because I visited a shopping site I frequently use and noticed things were different from usual. > > Thank you for creating and maintaining a wonderful product like Adblock. Best of luck. ``` Username: @timothy-jeong ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/bsstr5uekr4888scoco8ko8cwsswc0c2b6lzdclxs8.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/ojmvuqsvglwoss8wc0kogog4csw88gc2h3r1fqq5rw.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/afrg7l1ix40g0ckg8c0gwgs0sw0goscclaop7bj5xs.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/26j08xt0jb34kocsgsscss4s0wkcog8lj57of9ptdc.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Mac v2.17.3 System version: | `macOS Sonoma, 14.0, Apple M2` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Userscripts: | disabled Userstyles: | disabled Other extensions used: | `INISAFE SmartManagerEX, INISAFE CrossWeb EX, TouchEn PC` ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=mac&product_version=2.17.3&system_version=macOS+Sonoma%2C+14.0%2C+Apple+M2&browser=chrome&filters=2&dns.enabled=false&browsing_security.enabled=false&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=false)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://nuldam.com/product/%EA%B3%A0%EB%8B%A8%EB%B0%B1-%EC%A0%80%EB%8B%B9-%EB%84%A4%EB%AA%A8-%EB%B0%94%EA%B2%8C%ED%8A%B8-90g-6%EB%B4%89-5%EA%B0%80%EC%A7%80-%EB%A7%9B%EC%B4%9D-12%EB%B4%89/564/category/47/display/1/#prdReview](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnuldam.com%2Fproduct%2F%25EA%25B3%25A0%25EB%258B%25A8%25EB%25B0%25B1-%25EC%25A0%2580%25EB%258B%25B9-%25EB%2584%25A4%25EB%25AA%25A8-%25EB%25B0%2594%25EA%25B2%258C%25ED%258A%25B8-90g-6%25EB%25B4%2589-5%25EA%25B0%2580%25EC%25A7%2580-%25EB%25A7%259B%25EC%25B4%259D-12%25EB%25B4%2589%2F564%2Fcategory%2F47%2Fdisplay%2F1%2F%23prdReview) ### Comment > Following the issue linked below, it appears that several URLs important to online merchants are being blocked as advertisements [issue](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214522) > > The URLs being blocked, such as > - https://static.alphwidget.com/script/Common-Script/PRODUCTION/alphacore_alpha_data.js? > - https://static.alphwidget.com/script/Upsell-Script/PRODUCTION/alpha-upsell-shadow-bundle.js? > - and other URLs matching the static.alphwidget.com^ pattern > > are not harmful resources. These scripts provide useful information to web users, such as displaying product reviews or recommending similar items. They display content that the page administrator (the online seller) intends to show. > > Because of this, it seems the content provided by these links is not harmful advertising. As a user, I am personally experiencing difficulties, especially when I try to view product reviews. > > I do not want to go through the inconvenience of having to disable Adblock, which is supposed to block harmful ads, just to shop online. > > I am reporting this because I visited a shopping site I frequently use and noticed things were different from usual. > > Thank you for creating and maintaining a wonderful product like Adblock. Best of luck. ``` Username: @timothy-jeong ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/bsstr5uekr4888scoco8ko8cwsswc0c2b6lzdclxs8.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/ojmvuqsvglwoss8wc0kogog4csw88gc2h3r1fqq5rw.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/afrg7l1ix40g0ckg8c0gwgs0sw0goscclaop7bj5xs.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/26j08xt0jb34kocsgsscss4s0wkcog8lj57of9ptdc.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Mac v2.17.3 System version: | `macOS Sonoma, 14.0, Apple M2` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Userscripts: | disabled Userstyles: | disabled Other extensions used: | `INISAFE SmartManagerEX, INISAFE CrossWeb EX, TouchEn PC` ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=mac&product_version=2.17.3&system_version=macOS+Sonoma%2C+14.0%2C+Apple+M2&browser=chrome&filters=2&dns.enabled=false&browsing_security.enabled=false&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=false)

labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://nuldam.com/product/%EA%B3%A0%EB%8B%A8%EB%B0%B1-%EC%A0%80%EB%8B%B9-%EB%84%A4%EB%AA%A8-%EB%B0%94%EA%B2%8C%ED%8A%B8-90g-6%EB%B4%89-5%EA%B0%80%EC%A7%80-%EB%A7%9B%EC%B4%9D-12%EB%B4%89/564/category/47/display/1/#prdReview](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnuldam.com%2Fproduct%2F%25EA%25B3%25A0%25EB%258B%25A8%25EB%25B0%25B1-%25EC%25A0%2580%25EB%258B%25B9-%25EB%2584%25A4%25EB%25AA%25A8-%25EB%25B0%2594%25EA%25B2%258C%25ED%258A%25B8-90g-6%25EB%25B4%2589-5%25EA%25B0%2580%25EC%25A7%2580-%25EB%25A7%259B%25EC%25B4%259D-12%25EB%25B4%2589%2F564%2Fcategory%2F47%2Fdisplay%2F1%2F%23prdReview) ### Comment > Following the issue linked below, it appears that several URLs important to online merchants are being blocked as advertisements [issue](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214522) > > The URLs being blocked, such as > - https://static.alphwidget.com/script/Common-Script/PRODUCTION/alphacore_alpha_data.js? > - https://static.alphwidget.com/script/Upsell-Script/PRODUCTION/alpha-upsell-shadow-bundle.js? > - and other URLs matching the static.alphwidget.com^ pattern > > are not harmful resources. These scripts provide useful information to web users, such as displaying product reviews or recommending similar items. They display content that the page administrator (the online seller) intends to show. > > Because of this, it seems the content provided by these links is not harmful advertising. As a user, I am personally experiencing difficulties, especially when I try to view product reviews. > > I do not want to go through the inconvenience of having to disable Adblock, which is supposed to block harmful ads, just to shop online. > > I am reporting this because I visited a shopping site I frequently use and noticed things were different from usual. > > Thank you for creating and maintaining a wonderful product like Adblock. Best of luck. ``` Username: @timothy-jeong ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/bsstr5uekr4888scoco8ko8cwsswc0c2b6lzdclxs8.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/ojmvuqsvglwoss8wc0kogog4csw88gc2h3r1fqq5rw.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/afrg7l1ix40g0ckg8c0gwgs0sw0goscclaop7bj5xs.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/26j08xt0jb34kocsgsscss4s0wkcog8lj57of9ptdc.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Mac v2.17.3 System version: | `macOS Sonoma, 14.0, Apple M2` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Userscripts: | disabled Userstyles: | disabled Other extensions used: | `INISAFE SmartManagerEX, INISAFE CrossWeb EX, TouchEn PC` ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=mac&product_version=2.17.3&system_version=macOS+Sonoma%2C+14.0%2C+Apple+M2&browser=chrome&filters=2&dns.enabled=false&browsing_security.enabled=false&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=false)

comment.body:
@timothy-jeong Hi! I see that you've visited the website a lot. Could you please check these rules by adding them to user rules? It seems that the request is tracking the data, but if it's blocked, it's fine on my end.
```adblock
||static.alphwidget.com^$badfilter
||static.alphwidget.com/script/Upsell-Script/PRODUCTION/alphaupsell_log.js
```
